results.title: Sixty years later
results.brief_description: To mark the Australian visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II during the silver jubilee of her reign, Australia’s Navy, Army and Air Force combined to present a massed parade of personnel and colours in front of Parliament House, Canberra on 8 March 1977.

results.title: Sixteen days in September
results.brief_description: The September 2000 Olympic Games held in Sydney, Australia has been hailed as the Games that restored people’s faith in the Olympic movement. With a global participation of 11,000 athletes from 200 nations, this commemorative program captures all the greatest achievements and performances of Australia’s most successful Olympic team ever and shows all of their medal-winning performances, whether Gold, Silver or Bronze.

results.title: Six of the best?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
This film discusses the problem of how to control the unruly young - whether it is best to persuade, punish or to beat. Shows a row about corporal punishment in a detention school; an argument in every home in the country; headmasters vote overwhelmingly to retain the cane; parents in difficulty struggle to find a way to discipline.

results.title: Six of the best
results.brief_description: This series looks at issues which affect young adults in their daily life. Six teenagers, Brian, Antoni, Carl, Paula, Sally and Theresa deal with such problems as employment, school and relationships. Passing out, Early starters, Pay day, Pairing off, Shooting through, and Knockbacks.

results.title: Six minutes with nature
results.brief_description: The life cycle of a butterfly known as “The Wanderer” showing the egg, caterpillar, eating, chrysalis and final emergence of the butterfly. This film won a special award for the best nature film in the Commonwealth Jubilee Film Competition.

results.title: Six heavy fish and a ton of sinkers
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Historical re-enactments recount the story of the location, recovery and restoration of six cannons jettisoned by Captain James Cook when the “Endeavour” struck a reef off the coast of what is now Queensland. Good use of underwater photography.

results.title: Six Chevaux Bleus = Six Blue Horses
results.brief_description:
A Chinese man inherit six blue porcelain horses and discovers that one of them contains the combination to a safe filled with diamonds. In order to recover the diamonds which are guarded by an antiquarian, the old man’s nephews must contend with a gang of criminals.

Credits: Producer, Michel Peynet ; director, Philippe Joulia ; writers, Philippe Joulia, Yves Desmoulin ; photography, Jacques Ledoux ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Henri Cremieux, Yvonne Clech, Corinne Le Poulain, Patrick Boitet, Pascal Boitet.
